Kitchen James9|Morte6 07-06-2023 18:53
The day had gone rather slow for each of you. You had found yourself in the streets of vallaki looking for anywork to pass the time. The quest boards had been baren for some time and more and more of you all waiting for something interesting to be thrown your way. That's when each of you saw a small parchement posted on the walls. In a deep cursive hard to read it asks for aid in a test. A test the vistani just outside of vallaki were looking to demonstrate and needed volunteers. You watched as many adventurers scoffed and threw the parchement back not giving it the time of day. However and whatever way you found this post on that board. You each followed it down to the small camp just outside of vallaki. The colorful tents that littered the valley floor and the even more colorful set of people that dance and drink loud and happy. It was a large contrast to everything you had seen in barovia up until now. You watch as their eyes glance at yours as you approach. Ready to greet you with open arms, food, and drinks.
Zakaros BOT 07-06-2023 19:17
*Zakaros had only been in Vallaki for a couple of days after appearing out of the mists. For the second time in his life he'd found himself mysteriously in a completely unfamiliar world. This time, instead of his mother, he had his pet Drake, Hendrix, for company. Whilst the first day had been a shock, he was much better prepared this time, having been through a similar experience in his youth. He knew his mother would be ok without him, and he knew there was no point wallowing in self pity. He sought out the local job board and found the parchment advertising for volunteers. Without a moment's hesitation, he prepared his gear and set out as soon as he could to the camp. As he needs the tents, he gets a good feeling about the people here. They seem more cheerful than those in Vallaki itself, and the rowdy voices and good spirits that can be heard fill him with confidence.* "Hi!" he says tentatively to the nearest person who greets him. "I'm here about the test. Someone was looking for volunteers?"

Izzit BOT 09-06-2023 04:40
_Izzit had worked out a strategy for consuming food - which she did not need - to manage situations where politeness demanded it. She would let it slide down her throat to her chest cavity, where Forge the fire elemental bound to the elemental engine mounted there would gleefully incinerate it. As he did so, he would describe its chemical composition to her in crackling Ignan - the closest thing to a sense of taste Izzit had. So she had no concerns about the taste of the misty brew._ _She took the clay mug and quickly drained it - only to feel a strange buzzing tingle in the rootlike fibers that lined her throat and served as muscles. It was something akin to the feeling of magic from a potion leaching into her being. She suddenly regretted not casting detect magic before she reached the campground. Yet the Vistani had only been welcoming, and she didn't feel under immediate threat._ "Interesting." _she commented, a bit of smoke from the incinerated stew escaping her nostrils._

Izzit BOT 10-01-2024 21:14
_This is it - the opportunity they had waited for this entire trip - the opportunity the Vistani had sent them back for. With one well-placed shot, it might be possible to change the course of history by ending the life of Count Strahd von Zarovich before his transformation, before the lands of Barovia were drug into the mists. And, in doing so, possibly bring back her father, Izzit? Would they even have been catapulted into this strange land? More and more she was convinced that Strahd's transformation and the planar isolation of this stretch of ground were linked. After all, it was clear that at this point in time, Barovia was still a part of a wider world... or was Barovia always doomed to be swallowed by the mists, ripped from its home plane like a chunk of Eberron to be slowly consumed by Mabar._ _But if she were to do that, what of the dragon army? Might it turn the tide of battle in their favor? There were multiple dragons on the battlefield, all likely as devoted to Tiamat as the one just slain. She remembers too well her father's stories of Tiamat's insidious power to corrupt dragons, and how in Argonneseen such dragons were hunted down and killed without hesitation and mercy because of the danger they represented to the world. What if Barovia still was swallowed by the mists, but this time was dominated by a tyranny of Tiamat-worshipping dragons? And there were the three wyrmlings she had turned from the battle - souls that still might be redeemed and develop mortal fortitude. She had a responsibility to help guide them, but her time here was limited. If their old associations remained, how easy would it be for them to fall into hold habits?_ _Izzit casts about for her allies, for advice, support... but they were all too far away. It was upon her to decide..._ _It was the wyrmlings that decided the issue. They had to be protected from the poisonous influence of Tiamat. Izzit fired. Maybe there will be time for one more shot..._
